docs.lead_paragraph: The volatile trading that defined 2015 led to a very choppy market for companies wanting to go public.

headline.main: Market Volatility Causes IPO Market to Stall Out in 2015
headline.print_headline: Market Volatility Causes IPO Market to Stall Out in 2015

docs.lead_paragraph: Our cars, our homes, our appliances and even our toys: Things around us are going to keep getting smarter. In 2016, we'll entrust even more of our lives and their intimate details to machines — not to mention the companies that run them.

headline.main: Gadgets Around Us Will Keep Getting Smarter, Like It or Not
headline.print_headline: Gadgets Around Us Will Keep Getting Smarter, Like It or Not

docs.snippet: Our cars, our homes, our appliances and even our toys: Things around us are going to keep getting smarter. In 2016, we'll entrust even more of our lives and their intimate details to machines — not to mention the companies that run them.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a story Dec. 25 about Republican presidential candidate Ben Carson's business enterprises, The Associated Press reported erroneously that Lawrence Noble, a campaign-finance expert quoted in the story, was from the Campaign Finance Center. He is from the Campaign Legal Center.
docs.snippet: In a story Dec. 25 about Republican presidential candidate Ben Carson's business enterprises, The Associated Press reported erroneously that Lawrence Noble, a campaign-finance expert quoted in the story, was from the Campaign Finance Center. He is...

docs.lead_paragraph: In a story Dec. 31 about global deals, The Associated Press reported erroneously that Dow DuPont's products will include Teflon and Nylon. Teflon is made by Chemours, a company spun off from DuPont in 2015, and DuPont no longer makes Nylon. The story also reported that Dow Chemical is buying DuPont, while the companies say they are merging.

headline.main: Correction: Financial Markets-The Year in Deals Story
headline.print_headline: Correction: Financial Markets-The Year in Deals Story

docs.lead_paragraph: Doctors are testing ways to ease the cycle of hospitalization and lifetime disability that afflicts so many grappling with psychosis.

headline.main: Programs Expand Schizophrenic Patients’ Role in Their Own Care

docs.abstract: Emerging handful of small-scale programs are treating schizophrenia with combination of  sustained one-on-one therapy, school and work assistance, family education and medication; programs offer sufferers greater role in own treatment and provide alternative to poorly organized programs that focus on antipsychotic drugs.
docs.snippet: Doctors are testing ways to ease the cycle of hospitalization and lifetime disability that afflicts so many grappling with psychosis.

docs.lead_paragraph: The company said a team of executives would run the company in place of J. Michael Pearson, who had been hospitalized with pneumonia.

headline.main: Valeant Pharmaceuticals Confirms C.E.O. Is on Medical Leave
headline.print_headline: Team to Run Valeant in Chief’s Absence

docs.abstract: Valeant Pharmaceuticals announces chairman and chief executive J Michael Pearson is on medical leave and that team of executives is in charge.
docs.snippet: The company said a team of executives would run the company in place of J. Michael Pearson, who had been hospitalized with pneumonia.
